answers.a: It binds (chelates) calcium ions to form soluble complexes, keeping calcium in solution so it can’t precipitate or interact with proteins; it doesn’t truly remove calcium, it sequesters it.

answers.q: what is the current model that compares with the dell e544
answers.a: That’s unrelated to the food additive E544; E544 is the code for calcium polyphosphate, not a Dell device.

answers.q: what is the e number of calcium polyphosphate
